FitData.HarnessProject: MCC PCH w/EHL B0 RDL d18ww23_5

BootGrdWrn.label: Enable Boot Guard warning message at build time

PTTWrn.label: Enable Intel (R) Platform Trust Technology warning message at build time

IfwiBuildVersion.help_text: 32-bit value to use as the IFWI build version number

IfwiRedundancyEnabled.label: Redundancy Enabled
IfwiRedundancyEnabled.help_text: Enable Redundancy support for critical layout components

DescSigningKey.label: Descriptor Debug Signing Key
DescSigningKey.help_text: This is the path to the private debug key used to sign the Descriptor, while public key hash of it is included in the OEM hash manifest. This setting is operative only when Flash Descriptor Verification is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/FdvEnabled).

OemBinary.label: OEM Section Binary
OemBinary.help_text: This loads the OEM Section binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: BIOS Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the BIOS binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool.

Ifwi_IntelMePmcRegion.label: Ifwi: Intel(R) Me and PMC Region

MeRegionFile.label: Intel(R) CSE Binary File
MeRegionFile.help_text: This loads the Intel(R) CSE binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

ChipInitBinary.label: Chipset Initialization Binary
ChipInitBinary.help_text: This loads the Chipset Initialization binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

PmcBinary.label: PMC Binary File
PmcBinary.help_text: This loads the PMC binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

ResizeNftpForFtpr.label: Enables NFTP resize for FTPR loading
ResizeNftpForFtpr.help_text: Used to enable NFTP resize for FTPR loading to perform FWU process. Disable for SKU's and platforms with limited image size, without FWU support only.

InputFile.label: PCH Configuration File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the PCH Configuration binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: Intel(R) SI FW File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Intel(R) SI FW binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

ISIConfFile.label: Intel(R) SI Configuration File
ISIConfFile.help_text: Path of Intel(R) SI configuration binary

InputFile.label: FuSa Proof Test Configuration File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the FuSa Proof Test Configuration binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: PDR Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Platform Data region binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool.

Enabled.label: PDR Region Enable
Enabled.help_text: This option allows the user to enable or disable the Platform Data Region.

NumberOfComponents.label: Number of Flash Components
NumberOfComponents.help_text: Specifies the number of Flash components that will be installed on the target machine if using SPI.

FlashComponent1Size.label: Flash component 1 Size
FlashComponent1Size.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 1st Flash component.

FlashComponent2Size.label: Flash component 2 Size
FlashComponent2Size.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 2nd Flash component.

SpiGblProtRng.label: SPI Global Protected Range
SpiGblProtRng.help_text: Sets the default value of the Global Protected Range register in the SPI Flash Controller.

SpiIdlDpdwntimeout.label: SPI Idle to Deep Power Down Timeout
SpiIdlDpdwntimeout.help_text: SPI Idle to Deep Power Down Timeout Default Specifies the time in microseconds that the Flash Controller waits after all activity is idle before commanding the flash devices to Deep Power down, time = 2^N microseconds.

SpiOooEnable.label: SPI Out of Order operation Enabled
SpiOooEnable.help_text: When this setting is enabled priority operations may be issued while waiting for write / erase operations to complete on the flash device. When this setting is disabled all write / erase type operations in order.

SpiResHldDelay.label: SPI Resume Hold-off Delay
SpiResHldDelay.help_text: Specifies the time after the completion of a pri_op before the flash controller sends the resume instruction. If a new pri_op is eligible to be issued prior to the end of this delay time then the pri_op is issued and the timer is reinitialized to tRHD. 3-bit field encodes count with range 0-7. tRHD = count * 2us.

SpiMxWrErResSusInt.label: SPI Max write / erase Resume to Suspend intervals
SpiMxWrErResSusInt.help_text: This setting specifies the maximum value for the write and erase Resume to Suspend intervals.

SpiSusResEn.label: SPI Suspend / Resume Enabled
SpiSusResEn.help_text: When this setting is enabled writes and erases may be suspended to allow a read to be issued on the flash device. When this setting is disabled no transaction will be allowed to the busy flash device.

SoftReBindEnable.label: Software Re-Binding Enabled
SoftReBindEnable.help_text: When enabled this settings will allow for SPI re-binding to a new PCH during manufacturing and remanufacturing flows prior to platform EOM. Note: Re-binding to a replacement PCH can only be done a maximum of 5 times before the SPI part needs to be re-flashed.

HostCpuWriteAccessIntelRecommended.label: Host CPU / BIOS Write Access Intel Recommended
HostCpuWriteAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines Host CPU / BIOS write access to the other regions. Note: If pre-locking is not set, closemnf will revert back master access settings to 'golden master access settings'. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI Programming guide.

HostCpuWriteAccessCustom.label: Host CPU / BIOS Write Access Custom
HostCpuWriteAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines Host CPU / BIOS write access to the other regions. Note: If pre-locking is not set, closemnf will revert back master access settings to 'golden master access settings'. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI Programming guide.

HostCpuReadAccessIntelRecommended.label: Host CPU / BIOS Read Access Intel Recommended
HostCpuReadAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines Host CPU / BIOS read access to the other regions. Note: If pre-locking is not set, closemnf will revert back master access settings to 'golden master access settings'. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI Programming guide.

HostCpuReadAccessCustom.label: Host CPU / BIOS Read Access Custom
HostCpuReadAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines Host CPU / BIOS read access to the other regions. Note: If pre-locking is not set, closemnf will revert back master access settings to 'golden master access settings'. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI Programming guide

MeWriteAccessIntelRecommended.label: Intel(R) ME Write Access Intel Recommended
MeWriteAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines ME write access to the other regions. Note: If pre-locking is not set, closemnf will revert back master access settings to 'golden master access settings'. For further details on Region Access Control see SPI Programming guide.

MeWriteAccessCustom.label: Intel(R) ME Write Access Custom
MeWriteAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines ME write access to the other regions. Note: If pre-locking is not set, closemnf will revert back master access settings to 'golden master access settings'. For further details on Region Access Control see SPI Programming guide.

MeReadAccessIntelRecommended.label: Intel(R) ME Read Access Intel Recommended
MeReadAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines ME read access to the other regions. Note: If pre-locking is not set, closemnf will revert back master access settings to 'golden master access settings'. For further details on Region Access Control see SPI Programming guide.

MeReadAccessCustom.label: Intel(R) ME Read Access Custom
MeReadAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines ME read access to the other regions. Note: If pre-locking is not set, closemnf will revert back master access settings to 'golden master access settings'. For further details on Region Access Control see SPI Programming guide.

SpiDualIoReadEnable.label: Dual I/O Read Enable
SpiDualIoReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Dual I/O Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP.

SpiDualOutReadEnable.label: Dual Output Read Enable
SpiDualOutReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Dual Output Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP. If parameter table is not detected via the SFDP, this bit has no effect and Dual Output Read is controlled via the Flash Descriptor Component Section.Dual Output Fast Read Support bit.

FastReadClockFreq.label: Fast Read Clock Frequency
FastReadClockFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Fast Read. See SPI and SMIP Programming guide further details.

FastReadSupport.label: Fast Read Supported
FastReadSupport.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable support for Fast Read capabilities for flash components. See SPI and SMIP Programming guide further details. Note: This setting needs to be enabled when using Dual / Quad enabled components.

InvalidInstruction0.label: Invalid Instruction 0
InvalidInstruction0.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction1.label: Invalid Instruction 1
InvalidInstruction1.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction2.label: Invalid Instruction 2
InvalidInstruction2.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction3.label: Invalid Instruction 3
InvalidInstruction3.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction4.label: Invalid Instruction 4
InvalidInstruction4.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction5.label: Invalid Instruction 5
InvalidInstruction5.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction6.label: Invalid Instruction 6
InvalidInstruction6.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction7.label: Invalid Instruction 7
InvalidInstruction7.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

QuadIoReadEnable.label: Quad I/O Read Enable
QuadIoReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Quad I/O Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP.

QuadOutReadEnable.label: Quad Output Read Enable
QuadOutReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Quad Output Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP.

ReadIdAndReadStatClkFreq.label: Read ID and Read Status Clock Frequency
ReadIdAndReadStatClkFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Read ID and Read Status. See SPI and SMIP Programming guide further details.

WriteEraseClockFreq.label: Write and Erase Clock Frequency
WriteEraseClockFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Write and Erase. See SPI and SMIP Programming guide further details.

VsccEntryName.label: Part Name
VsccEntryName.help_text: This setting allow the OEM input a name designation for each flash component being used. Note: This is a free form entry field it does not affect actual flash component operation.

VsccEntryVendorId.label: Vendor ID
VsccEntryVendorId.help_text: This configures the JEDEC vendor specific byte ID of the SPI flash Component see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

VsccEntryDeviceId0.label: Device ID 0
VsccEntryDeviceId0.help_text: This configures the JEDEC device specific byte ID 0 of the SPI flash Component see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

VsccEntryDeviceId1.label: Device ID 1
VsccEntryDeviceId1.help_text: This configures the JEDEC device specific byte ID 1 of the SPI flash Component see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

BiosRedAssistance.label: BIOS Redundancy Assistance
BiosRedAssistance.help_text: In case of BIOS boot failure, CSME will configure the platform to boot with backup BIOS using Top Swap. Note: This option is only available when Boot Guard is enabled.

TopSwapOverride.label: Top Swap Block Size
TopSwapOverride.help_text: This configures the Top Swap Block size for the platform. For further details see Elkhart Lake Platform Controller Hub EDS.

HwBindingEn.label: Hardware Binding Enabled
HwBindingEn.help_text: This setting configures the FPF Hardware and RPMC / RPMB binding behavior for the platform image. If this setting is enabled FPF Hardware and RPMC / RPMB binding behavior will occur when platform close manufacturing flow is executed with Intel® FPT. If this setting is disabled FPF Hardware and RPMC / RPMB binding behavior will not take place when close manufacturing flow is executed. Note: For Revenue parts this setting will be ignored and FPF Hardware and RPMC / RPMB binding behavior will take place when close manufacturing flow is executed.

RpmcSupported.label: RPMC Supported
RpmcSupported.help_text: This setting determines if RPMC is enabled. Note: The SPI parts being used need to support RPMC In order to use this feature.

RpmcRebindEn.label: RPMC Rebinding Enabled
RpmcRebindEn.help_text: This setting determines if Rebinding of RPMC enabled SPI parts is enabled.

FwUpdateOemId.label: Firmware Update OEM ID
FwUpdateOemId.help_text: This setting allows configuration of an OEM unique ID to ensure that customers can only update their platform with images from the OEM of the platform.

HideMEBxFwUpdCtrl.label: Hide MEBx Firmware Update Control
HideMEBxFwUpdCtrl.help_text: This setting allows customers to hide the Firmware Update option in the MEBx interface.

HmrfpoEnable.label: Intel(R) CSE Region Flash Protection Override
HmrfpoEnable.help_text: This setting enables descriptor unlock of the ME Region when the HMRFPO message is sent to firmware prior to BIOS End of POST.

FwAutoBist.label: Automatic Built in Self Test
FwAutoBist.help_text: This setting enables the firmware Automatic Built in Self Test which is executed during first platform boot after initial image flashing.

EomFirstBootEnabled.label: EOM on First Boot Enabled
EomFirstBootEnabled.help_text: This setting detremines if End of Manufacturing will be triggered on first boot of the platform after flashing. Note: When this setting is enabled Intel(R) CSME will enter End of Manufacturing regardless of the descriptor settings.

FlexibleEomSettings.value_list: Lock Descriptor and OEM Configs,,Lock OEM Configs Only,,Lock Descriptor Only,,Do not lock Descriptor and OEM Configs
FlexibleEomSettings.label: Flexible EOM setting options
FlexibleEomSettings.help_text: This setting deteremines which settings will be automatically commited during End of Manufacturing flows. Note: The FPFs, RPMB / RPMC and set manufacturing mode settings are mandatory and cannot be overridden revenue parts. Simulation can be done on non-revenue part with the Hardware binding set to disabled.

PrtcBackupPower.label: Persistent PRTC Backup Power
PrtcBackupPower.help_text: FPF that indicates if the device is designed such that it may lose PRTC power more than 10 times throughout the normal lifecycle of the product and hence has no persistent time or AR protection. At EOM, this value is burned to an FPF, and can never be changed.

MeMeasuredBootState.label: Intel(R) CSE Measured Boot State
MeMeasuredBootState.help_text: When measured boot is enabled firmware will use additional extended registers for all IUPs and Key Manifests that firmware loads and verifies from flash. Note: When measured boot is enabled any IUPs or firmware updates will require a global reset

MeBiosBootAssist.label: Intel(R) CSE Assisted BIOS Boot
MeBiosBootAssist.help_text: This setting configures Intel(R) CSE Assisted BIOS Boot capabilities.

PavpSupported.label: PAVP Supported
PavpSupported.help_text: This setting determines if the Protected Audio Video Path (PAVP) feature will be permanently disabled in the FW image.

Hdcp5kedisp1.label: HDCP Internal Display Port 1 - 5K
Hdcp5kedisp1.help_text: This setting determines which port is connected for 5K output on Internal Display 1. Note: Both Display 1 & 2 need to be configured for proper operation.

Hdcp5kedisp2.label: HDCP Internal Display Port 2 - 5K
Hdcp5kedisp2.help_text: This setting determines which port is connected for 5K output on Internal Display 2. Note: Both Display 1 & 2 need to be configured for proper operation.

GucHash.label: GuC Encryption Key
GucHash.help_text: This option is for entering the raw hash 256 bit string for the Graphics uController.

OemPublicKeyHash.value: F8 F0 E3 69 15 81 76 99 0A 54 9E D4 C3 6D 1A 86 39 D8 87 3D EF F7 ED 2D E3 4C B4 1B CC B3 04 76 CE 0A A0 63 BC 5B 7A AC FF D9 50 9E 96 40 C6 99
OemPublicKeyHash.label: OEM Public Key Hash
OemPublicKeyHash.help_text: Raw hash string for the SHA-384 hash of the OEM public key corresponding to the private key used to sign the OEM Key hash manifest. When manufacture is completed, this hash value is burned into an FPF, and is permament. This value is used to verify the OEM Key hash, and also DnX images. OEM signing is disabled when this hash is set to all 0s.

OemExtInputFile.label: OEM Key Manifest Binary
OemExtInputFile.help_text: Signed manifest file containing hashes of keys used for signing components of image. This setting is only configurable when OEM signing is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

OemKeyRevEnable.label: Oem Key Revocation Enable
OemKeyRevEnable.help_text: Enabling the OEM key revocation mechanism requires 'OEM Public Key Hash' and 'Second OEM key hash' to be configured.

SkipOemKeysCheck.label: Skip OEM Keys Check
SkipOemKeysCheck.help_text: This is meant for debugging purposes only. Enabling this parameter impacts image creation procedure in FIT tool only.

excludeMasterAccsess.label: exclude master access in the signature
excludeMasterAccsess.help_text: include/exclude master access in the signature.

Range1Offset.label: Range 1 offset
Range1Offset.help_text: Range 1 offset covers manifest, cannot be changed

Range1Size.label: Range 1 size
Range1Size.help_text: Range 1 size covers manifest, cannot be changed

Range2Offset.label: Range 2 offset
Range2Offset.help_text: Range 2 offset covers master accsess ofsset

Range2Size.label: Range 2 size
Range2Size.help_text: Range 2 size covers master accsess size

Range3Offset.label: Range 3 offset
Range3Offset.help_text: Range 3 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range3Size.label: Range 3 size
Range3Size.help_text: Range 3 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

Range4Offset.label: Range 4 offset
Range4Offset.help_text: Range 4 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range4Size.label: Range 4 size
Range4Size.help_text: Range 4 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

Range5Offset.label: Range 5 offset
Range5Offset.help_text: Range 5 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range5Size.label: Range 5 size
Range5Size.help_text: Range 5 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

Range6Offset.label: Range 6 offset
Range6Offset.help_text: Range 6 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range6Size.label: Range 6 size
Range6Size.help_text: Range 6 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

Range7Offset.label: Range 7 offset
Range7Offset.help_text: Range 7 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range7Size.label: Range 7 size
Range7Size.help_text: Range 7 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

Range8Offset.label: Range 8 offset
Range8Offset.help_text: Range 8 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range8Size.label: Range 8 size
Range8Size.help_text: Range 8 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

BtGuardKeyManifestId.label: Key Manifest ID
BtGuardKeyManifestId.help_text: ODM identifier used during the Key manifest authentication process. This setting is only configurable, and must be non-0, when OEM Public Key Hash is set (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

BtGuardProfileConfig.value_list: Boot Guard Profile 0 - No_FVME,,Boot Guard Profile 3 - VM,,Boot Guard Profile 4 - FVE,,Boot Guard Profile 5 - FVME
BtGuardProfileConfig.label: Boot Guard Profile Configuration
BtGuardProfileConfig.help_text: Boot Guard Profile 0 - Legacy is for platforms that do not wish to enable Boot Guard boot block verification or measurement protection. When manufacture is completed, this value is burned into an FPF, and is permanent. This setting is only configurable when OEM signing is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

BtGuardCpuDebugEnable.label: CPU Debugging
BtGuardCpuDebugEnable.help_text: This setting determines if CPU debug modes will be displayed. When set to 'Yes' CPU debugging is enabled.

BtGuardBspInitEnable.label: BSP Initialization
BtGuardBspInitEnable.help_text: This setting determines BSP behavior when it receives an INIT signal. When set to 'Yes', when BSP receives an INIT, BSP will signal an error to the BSS register and enter unrecoverable shutdown.

PttSupported.label: Intel(R) PTT Supported
PttSupported.help_text: This setting permanently disables Intel(R) PTT in the firmware image.

PttSupportedFpf.label: Intel(R) PTT Supported [FPF]
PttSupportedFpf.help_text: This setting will permanently disable Intel(R) PTT through platform FPFs. Caution: Using this option will permanently disable Intel(R) PTT on the platform hardware.

SpiOverTpmBusEnable.label: TPM Over SPI Bus Enabled
SpiOverTpmBusEnable.help_text: This setting determines the clock frequency setting to be used for the TPM over SPI bus.

SpiOverTpmClkFreq.label: TPM Clock Frequency
SpiOverTpmClkFreq.help_text: This setting determines the clock frequency setting to be used for the TPM over SPI bus.

FuSaPrfTestComponents.label: FuSa Proof Test Components
FuSaPrfTestComponents.help_text: This setting determines which FuSa tests will be run based on the mask value input. Note: See Firmware Bring-up Guide for valid values.

FailsafeBootProfile.label: Failsafe Boot Profile
FailsafeBootProfile.help_text: Boot profile used when system instability is detected.

ProfileChangeable.label: Profile Changeable
ProfileChangeable.help_text: True = Allows user to change boot profile via BIOS menu or 3rd party application False = Prevents user from changing boot profile via BIOS or 3rd party application. Note: When false, Failsafe Boot Profile must be the same as Boot Profile.

IsBclkConfValid.label: BCLK Build-time Clock Configuration Enabled
IsBclkConfValid.help_text: Enables/disables BCLK Build-time Clock configuration values for adaptive profiles.

BclkFreq.label: BCLK Clock Frequency
BclkFreq.help_text: Displays the nominal frequency for the selected clock.

BclkSsc.label: BCLK Spread setting
BclkSsc.help_text: Displays the percentage of Spread setting for the selected clock.

ProfileName.label: Profile Name
ProfileName.help_text: Editable text string stored with the profile for easy identification.

ProfileType.label: Profile Type
ProfileType.help_text: Specifies the profile template used when creating the profile. Intel (R) ME image has to be loaded to enable other ICC profile settings.

BClkSscHalt.label: BCLK SSC Halt Allowed
BClkSscHalt.help_text: If set to Yes, the spread generator can be enabled and disabled at runtime.

ClkoutSRC0.label: SRC0
ClkoutSRC0.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC0 differential output buffer.

ClkoutSRC1.label: SRC1
ClkoutSRC1.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC1 differential output buffer.

ClkoutSRC2.label: SRC2
ClkoutSRC2.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC2 differential output buffer.

ClkoutSRC3.label: SRC3
ClkoutSRC3.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC3 differential output buffer.

ClkoutSRC4.label: SRC4
ClkoutSRC4.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC4 differential output buffer.

ClkoutSRC5.label: SRC5
ClkoutSRC5.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC5 differential output buffer.

ClkreqMapSRC0.label: SRC0 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC0.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC0. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

ClkreqMapSRC1.label: SRC1 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC1.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC1. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

ClkreqMapSRC2.label: SRC2 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC2.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC2. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

ClkreqMapSRC3.label: SRC3 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC3.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC3. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

ClkreqMapSRC4.label: SRC4 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC4.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC4. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

ClkreqMapSRC5.label: SRC5 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC5.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC5. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

TimeSensitiveNetworkingConfiguration.label: Gigabit and Time Sensitive Networking Configuration

TsnEnabled.label: Gigabit and Time Sensitive Networking
TsnEnabled.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable Gigabit and Time Sensitive Networking on the platform.

Psegbe0PhyIfMode.label: Intel(R) PSE GbE 0 Phy Interface Mode
Psegbe0PhyIfMode.help_text: This setting determines what mode the Intel(R) PSE GbE 0 Phy Interface will be running in RGMII or SGMII.

Psegbe1PhyIfMode.label: Intel(R) PSE GbE 1 Phy Interface Mode
Psegbe1PhyIfMode.help_text: This setting determines what mode the Intel(R) PSE GbE 1 Phy Interface will be running in RGMII or SGMII.

PseGbe1obEnable.label: Intel(R) PSE GbE 1 OOB Enabled
PseGbe1obEnable.help_text: This setting enables OOB on Intel(R) PSE GbE 1.

PseGbeOobEnable.label: Intel(R) PSE GbE 0 OOB Enabled
PseGbeOobEnable.help_text: This setting enables OOB on Intel(R) PSE GbE 0.

t573TimingConfig.label: PCH clock output stable to PROCPWRGD high (tPCH45)
t573TimingConfig.help_text: This setting configures the minimum timing from XCK_PLL locked to CPUPWRGD high. For further details see Elkhart Lake Platform Controller Hub EDS.

t36TimerEnable.label: PCIe Power Stable Timer (tPCH33)
t36TimerEnable.help_text: This setting configures the enables / disables the tPCH33 timer. When enabled PCH will count 99ms from PWROK assertion before PLTRST# is de-asserted. Note: The recommended setting is ""Disabled""

t1001TimingConfig.label: PROCPWRGD and SYS_PWROK high to SUS_STAT# de-assertion (tPCH46)
t1001TimingConfig.help_text: This setting configures the minimum timing from CPUPWRGD assertion to SUS_STAT#. For further details see Elkhart Lake Controller Hub EDS.

EspiEcMaxIoMode.value_list: Single,,Single and Dual,,Single and Quad,,Single, Dual and Quad
EspiEcMaxIoMode.label: eSPI / EC Maximum I/O Mode
EspiEcMaxIoMode.help_text: Indicates the maximum IO Mode (Single/Dual/Quad) of the eSPI bus that is supported by the eSPI Master and specific platform configuration. The actual IO Mode of the eSPI bus will be the minimum of this field and the Slave's maximum IO Mode advertised in its General Capabilities register.

EspiEcCrcCheckEnable.label: eSPI / EC CRC Check Enabled
EspiEcCrcCheckEnable.help_text: This setting enables CRC checking on eSPI Slave 0 channel.

EspiEcSlv3DevBusfreq.label: eSPI Slave 3 Device Bus Frequency
EspiEcSlv3DevBusfreq.help_text: This setting configures the maximum operating frequency of the Slave device.

EspiSlaveSlve1CrcChkEn.label: eSPI Slave 1 Device CRC Check Enable
EspiSlaveSlve1CrcChkEn.help_text: This setting determines if CRC checking is enabled on the eSPI Slave 1 Device channel.

EspiSlv1DevMaxIoMode.value_list: Single,,Single and Duel,,Single and Quad,,Single, Dual and Quad
EspiSlv1DevMaxIoMode.label: eSPI Slave 1 Device Maximum I/O Mode
EspiSlv1DevMaxIoMode.help_text: This setting configures the maximum I/O mode of the Slave device.

EspiSlv1DevBusfreq.label: eSPI Slave 1 Device Bus Frequency
EspiSlv1DevBusfreq.help_text: This setting configures the maximum operating frequency of the Slave device.

EspiSlv1DeviceEn.label: eSPI Slave 1 Device Enabled
EspiSlv1DeviceEn.help_text: This setting determines if CRC checking is enabled on the eSPI Slave 1 Device channel.

EspiSlaveBusfreq.label: eSPI Slave Bus Frequency
EspiSlaveBusfreq.help_text: Indicates the maximum frequency of the eSPI bus that is supported by the eSPI Master and platform configuration (trace length, number of Slaves, etc.). The actual frequency of the eSPI bus will be the minimum of this field and the Slave's maximum frequency advertised in its General Capabilities register.

EspiSlv2DevBusfreq.label: SPI Slave 2 Device Bus Frequency
EspiSlv2DevBusfreq.help_text: This setting configures the maximum operating frequency of the Slave device.

EspiSlv2DevMaxIoMode.value_list: Single,,Single and Duel,,Single and Quad,,Single, Dual and Quad
EspiSlv2DevMaxIoMode.label: eSPI Slave 2 Device Maximum I/O Mode
EspiSlv2DevMaxIoMode.help_text: This setting configures the maximum I/O mode of the Slave device.

EspiSlv2CrcChkEn.label: eSPI Slave 2 Device CRC Check Enable
EspiSlv2CrcChkEn.help_text: This setting determines if CRC checking is enabled on the eSPI Slave 2 Device channel.

EspiSlv2DeviceEn.label: eSPI Slave 2 Device Enabled
EspiSlv2DeviceEn.help_text: This setting enables the Slave device on the eSPI interface.

EspiSlv3DevMaxIoMode.value_list: Single,,Single and Duel,,Single and Quad,,Single, Dual and Quad
EspiSlv3DevMaxIoMode.label: eSPI Slave 3 Device Maximum I/O Mode
EspiSlv3DevMaxIoMode.help_text: This setting configures the maximum I/O mode of the Slave device.

EspiSlv3CrcChkEn.label: eSPI Slave 3 Device CRC Check Enable
EspiSlv3CrcChkEn.help_text: This setting determines if CRC checking is enabled on the eSPI / EC Slave 2 Device channel.

EspiSlv3DeviceEn.label: eSPI Slave 3 Device Enabled
EspiSlv3DeviceEn.help_text: This setting enables the Slave device on the eSPI interface.

SlpS0TunnelDis.label: SLP_S0# Tunnel
SlpS0TunnelDis.help_text: This setting Enables / Disables the tunneling of the SLP_S0# pin over ESPI to the EC when in ESPI mode.

BattLowDetectEn.label: PMC_BATLOW_N / GP_DSW0 Signal Configuration
BattLowDetectEn.help_text: This setting allows the to assign the PMC_BATLOW_N Power Control signal as PMC_BATLOW_N or as GP_DSW0.

PmcSlpS5nGpdsw10Config.label: PMC_SLP_S5_N / GP_DSW10 Signal Configuration
PmcSlpS5nGpdsw10Config.help_text: This setting allows the to assign the PMC_SLP_S5_N Power Control signal as PMC_SLP_S5_N or as GP_DSW10. For further details see Elkhart Lake EDS.

PmcSlpS4nDpdsw05Config.label: PMC_SLP_S4_N / DP_DSW05 Signal Configuration
PmcSlpS4nDpdsw05Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the PMC_SLP_S4_N Power Control signal as PMC_SLP_S4_N or as DP_DSW05. For further details see Elkhart Lake Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PmcSlpS3nGpdsw04Config.label: PMC_SLP_S3_N / GP_DSW04 Signal Configuration
PmcSlpS3nGpdsw04Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the PMC_SLP_S3_N Power Control signal as PMC_SLP_S3_N or as GP_DSW04. For further details see Elkhart Lake Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PchThrmlRprtngEn.label: Thermal Power Reporting Enabled
PchThrmlRprtngEn.help_text: This setting enabled a once-per-second timer interrupt is enabled which triggers firmware to report power and temperature information as enabled by configuration registers. Note: When this setting is disabled ensure that the once-per-second timer interrupt associated with this feature is also disabled.

IdlmFile.label: IDLM Binary
IdlmFile.help_text: This allows an IDLM binary to be merged into output image built by Intel (R) FIT

DelayedAuthMode.label: Delayed Authentication Mode Enabled
DelayedAuthMode.help_text: This setting enables Delayed Authentication Mode on the platform.

IntelTrcHubBinary.label: Intel(R) Trace Hub Binary
IntelTrcHubBinary.help_text: This loads the Intel(R) Trace Hub binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

RomTraceEmergencyModeEn.label: Intel(R) Trace Hub Emergency Mode Enabled
RomTraceEmergencyModeEn.help_text: When enabled, Intel(R) CSE programs Intel(R) Trace hub to send debug traces without target configuration from the Intel(R) System Studio tool. Note: When Intel(R) Trace Hub is enabled to send messages, it might prevent the system from entering deeper sleep states. This is intended for debug purposes only and should not be used in "the" shipping configuration.

RomTraceFiltering.label: Intel(R) Trace Hub Filtering
RomTraceFiltering.help_text: This setting allows a user input binary for filtering of output messages for Intel(R) Trace Hub

RomTraceDbgMsgsEnable.label: Intel(R) Trace Hub Debug Messages Enabled
RomTraceDbgMsgsEnable.help_text: Intel(R) Trace Hub Debug Messages Enabled - When set to Yes, enables Intel(R) PCH HW trace messages. Note: DCI needs to be enabled on the platform for Intel(R) Trace Hub messages to be captured.

UnlockToken.label: Unlock Token
UnlockToken.help_text: This allows the OEM to input an Unlock Token binary file for closed chassis debug.

DbgOverridePreProdSi.label: Debug Override Pre-Production Silicon
DbgOverridePreProdSi.help_text: Allows the OEM to control FW features to assist with pre-production platform debugging. This control has no effect if used on production silicon. Note: Certain options will do not work when the descriptor is locked (See FW Bring-up Guide for setting details).

DbgOverrideProdSi.label: Debug Override Production Silicon
DbgOverrideProdSi.help_text: Allows the OEM to control FW features to assist with production platform debugging. Note: Certain options will do not work when the descriptor is locked (See FW Bring-up Guide for setting details).

MERomBypassEnable.label: Firmware ROM Bypass
MERomBypassEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables firmware ROM bypass. Note: This setting only has affect when the firmware being used has ROM Bypass code present.

AfsIdleReclaim.label: AFS Idle Flash Reclaim Enabled
AfsIdleReclaim.help_text: This controls enabling / disabling of Intel(R) CSE AFS Idle flash reclaim capabilities. Note: This setting should be used for debug purposes only.

MeRstBehavior.value_list: Intel(R) ME Alternate image boot,,Intel(R) ME will Halt
MeRstBehavior.label: Intel(R) CSE Reset Behavior
MeRstBehavior.help_text: This setting determines Intel(R) CSE behavior when boot image errors are encountered. Warning: This setting should be used for debug purposes only.

DciEnable.label: Direct Connect Interface (DCI) Enabled
DciEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the DCI interface used for Intel(R) Trace Hub debugging.

Usb1DciOobEnable.label: DCI OOB over USB3 Port1 Enabled
Usb1DciOobEnable.help_text: This setting determines if the USB port being enabled for DCI OOB. If disabled it will block DCI OOB connection.

Usb2DciOobEnable.label: DCI OOB over USB3 Port2 Enabled
Usb2DciOobEnable.help_text: This setting determines if the USB port being enabled for DCI OOB. If disabled it will block DCI OOB connection.

Usb3DciOobEnable.label: DCI OOB over USB3 Port3 Enabled
Usb3DciOobEnable.help_text: This setting determines if the USB port being enabled for DCI OOB. If disabled it will block DCI OOB connection.

Usb4DciOobEnable.label: DCI OOB over USB3 Port4 Enabled
Usb4DciOobEnable.help_text: This setting determines if the USB port being enabled for DCI OOB. If disabled it will block DCI OOB connection.

EspiEcLowFreqOvrd.label: eSPI / EC Low Frequency Debug Override
EspiEcLowFreqOvrd.help_text: When enabled this setting will divide eSPI clock frequency by 8. Note: This setting should only be used for debugging purposes. Leaving this setting enable will impact eSPI performance.

EarlyUsb2DbcOverType-AConfiguration.label: Early USB2 DBC over Type-A Configuration

Usb2DbcPortEn.value_list: USB2 Port 1,,USB2 Port 2,,USB2 Port 3,,USB2 Port 4,,USB2 Port 5,,USB2 Port 6,,USB2 Port 7,,USB2 Port 8,,USB2 Port 9,,USB2 Port 10,,No USB2 Ports
Usb2DbcPortEn.label: USB2 DbC port enable
Usb2DbcPortEn.help_text: This setting determines which USB2 ports are enabled for Early DbC debugging.

Usb3DbcPortEn.value_list: USB3 Port 1,,USB3 Port 2,,USB3 Port 3,,USB3 Port 4,,No USB3 Ports
Usb3DbcPortEn.label: USB Connectors Associated USB3 Port enable
Usb3DbcPortEn.help_text: This setting determines which USB3 port goes to the target USB2 ports connector for Early DbC debugging.

EnEarlyUsb2DbcCon.label: Enable early USB2 DbC connection
EnEarlyUsb2DbcCon.help_text: This setting enables a delay during Intel(R) CSE FW bring-up to allow USB2 DbC connection to be established.

TrcEnable.label: TRC Enabled
TrcEnable.help_text: When enabled the TRC HIP and TRC Countermeasures are enabled. The purpose of this setting is to allow OEMs to enable TRC for testing prior to close of manufacturing and FPF commit.

TrcEnableFpf.label: TRC Enabled (FPF)
TrcEnableFpf.help_text: When enabled the TRC HIP and TRC Countermeasures are enabled. When manufacture is completed, this value is burned into an FPF.

NumActiveCores.value_list: All Cores Active,,1 Core Active,,2 Cores Active,,3 Cores Active,,4 Cores Active
NumActiveCores.label: Number of Active Cores
NumActiveCores.help_text: This setting controls the number of active processor cores. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposed only. See BIOS Spec for more details on enabling / disabling processor cores.

BistInit.label: BIST Initialization
BistInit.help_text: This setting determines if BIST will be run at platform reset after BIOS requested actions. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposed only.

FlexRatio.label: Flex Ratio
FlexRatio.help_text: This setting controls the maximum processor non-turbo ratio. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposed only. See BIOS Spec for more details on maximum processor non-turbo ratio configuration.

JtagPwrDisable.value: No JTAG Power on C10 and Lower
JtagPwrDisable.value_list: No JTAG Power on C10 and Lower,,JTAG Power on C10 and Lower
JtagPwrDisable.label: JTAG Power Disable
JtagPwrDisable.help_text: This setting determines if JTAG power will be maintained on C10 or lower power states. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposed only.

PlatformImonDisable.label: Platform IMON
PlatformImonDisable.help_text: This strap should be left at the recommended default setting.

VccSfrOcPgPresent.label: VCC SFR OC PG Present
VccSfrOcPgPresent.help_text: This setting determines if VCC SFR OC PG is present on the platform.

VssStPgPresent.label: VCC ST PG Present
VssStPgPresent.help_text: This setting determines if VCC ST PG is present on the platform.

VssStgPgPresent.label: VCC STG PG Present
VssStgPgPresent.help_text: This setting determines if VCC STG PG is present on the platform.

PCIeCtrl0LnReversal.label: PCIe Controller 0 Lane Reversal Enabled
PCIeCtrl0LnReversal.help_text: This setting allows the PCIe lanes on Controller 0 to be reversed. For further details see Elkhart Lake Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PCIeContoller0Config.label: PCIe Controller 0 (Port 0-3)
PCIeContoller0Config.help_text: This setting controls PCIe Port configurations for PCIe Controller 0. For further details see Elkhart Lake EDS.

PCIeMltVcCont1Conf.value_list: Disabled,,x1 PCIe on Lane 7,,x1 PCIe on Lane 8,,x1 PCIe on Lane 10,,x2 PCIe on Lanes 8 and 9,,x2 PCIe on Lanes 10 and 11
PCIeMltVcCont1Conf.label: PCIe Multi VC Controller 1
PCIeMltVcCont1Conf.help_text: This setting controls PCIe Port configuration for PCIe Multi VC Controller 1. For further details see Elkhart Lake EDS. (Select “Disabled” when selecting the SATA/PCIe Combo Port 0/1 = GPIO Polarity PCIe options).

PCIeMltVcCont2Conf.value_list: Disabled,,x1 PCIe on Lane 2,,x1 PCIe on Lane 4,,x2 PCIe on Lanes 2 and 3,,x2 PCIe on Lanes 4 and 5
PCIeMltVcCont2Conf.label: PCIe Multi VC Controller 2
PCIeMltVcCont2Conf.help_text: This setting controls PCIe Port configurations for PCIe Multi VC Controller 2. For further details see Elkhart Lake EDS.

PCIeMltVcCont3Conf.value_list: Disabled,,x1 PCIe on Lane 6,,x2 PCIe on Lanes 6 and 7
PCIeMltVcCont3Conf.label: PCIe Multi VC Controller 3
PCIeMltVcCont3Conf.help_text: This setting controls PCIe Port configurations for PCIe Multi VC Controller 3. For further details see Elkhart Lake Platform EDS.

SataPCIeComboPort0.label: SATA / PCIe Combo Port 0
SataPCIeComboPort0.help_text: This setting configures the Flex I/O port to operate as either PCIe Port 10 or SATA Port 10. For further details on Flex I/O see Elkhart Lake Platform Controller Hub EDS. (Select “GPIO Polarity PCIe” to use the SATAXPCIE signal controlled PCIe*/SATA multiplexing, to support a x1 NVMe or SATA M.2 SSD).

SataPCIeComboPort1.label: SATA / PCIe Combo Port 1
SataPCIeComboPort1.help_text: This setting configures the Flex I/O port to operate as either PCIe Port 11 or SATA Port 11. For further details on Flex I/O see Elkhart Lake Platform Controller Hub EDS (Select “GPIO Polarity PCIe” to use the SATAXPCIE signal controlled PCIe*/SATA multiplexing, to support a x2 NVMe M.2 SSD).

USB3PCIeComboPort0.label: USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 0
USB3PCIeComboPort0.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 3 or USB3 Port 3. For further details on Flex I/O see Elkhart Lake Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This setting will be grayed out if DCI BSSB over USB3 Port3 Enabled is set to 'yes

USB3PCIeComboPort1.label: USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 1
USB3PCIeComboPort1.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 4 or USB3 Port 4. For further details on Flex I/O see Elkhart Lake Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This setting will be grayed out if DCI BSSB over USB3 Port4 Enabled is set to 'yes

USB3Prt1ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB3Prt1ConTypeSel.label: USB3 Port 1 Connector Type Select
USB3Prt1ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the Super Speed / Enhanced Super Speed port is routed.

USB3Prt2ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB3Prt2ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB3Prt2ConTypeSel.label: USB3 Port 2 Connector Type Select
USB3Prt2ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the Super Speed / Enhanced Super Speed port is routed.

USB3Prt3ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB3Prt3ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB3Prt3ConTypeSel.label: USB3 Port 3 Connector Type Select
USB3Prt3ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the Super Speed / Enhanced Super Speed port is routed.

USB3Prt4ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB3Prt4ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB3Prt4ConTypeSel.label: USB3 Port 4 Connector Type Select
USB3Prt4ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the Super Speed / Enhanced Super Speed port is routed.

USB3Port1IntSpdSel.value_list: USB3.1 Gen1 LBPM,,USB3.1 Gen2 Skip LBPM
USB3Port1IntSpdSel.label: USB3 Port 1 Initialization Speed Select
USB3Port1IntSpdSel.help_text: This setting determines USB3 Port 1 speed during platform power-up. Note: When configured to USB 3.1 Gen1 the port will also perform carry on LBPM if USB 3.1 is Gen2 enabled.

USB3Port2IntSpdSel.value_list: USB3.1 Gen1 LBPM,,USB3.1 Gen2 Skip LBPM
USB3Port2IntSpdSel.label: USB3 Port 2 Initialization Speed Select
USB3Port2IntSpdSel.help_text: This setting determines USB3 Port 2 speed during platform power-up. Note: When configured to USB 3.1 Gen1 the port will also perform carry on LBPM if USB 3.1 is Gen2 enabled.

USB3Port3IntSpdSel.value_list: USB3.1 Gen1 LBPM,,USB3.1 Gen2 Skip LBPM
USB3Port3IntSpdSel.label: USB3 Port 3 Initialization Speed Select
USB3Port3IntSpdSel.help_text: This setting determines USB3 Port 3 speed during platform power-up. Note: When configured to USB 3.1 Gen1 the port will also perform carry on LBPM if USB 3.1 is Gen2 enabled.

USB3Port4IntSpdSel.value_list: USB3.1 Gen1 LBPM,,USB3.1 Gen2 Skip LBPM
USB3Port4IntSpdSel.label: USB3 Port 4 Initialization Speed Select
USB3Port4IntSpdSel.help_text: This setting determines USB3 Port 4 speed during platform power-up. Note: When configured to USB 3.1 Gen1 the port will also perform carry on LBPM if USB 3.1 is Gen2 enabled.

USB3Port1SpdCap.label: USB3 Port 1 Speed Capability
USB3Port1SpdCap.help_text: This setting determines the USB3 Port 1 speed capabilities.

USB3Port2SpdCap.label: USB3 Port 2 Speed Capability
USB3Port2SpdCap.help_text: This setting determines the USB3 Port 2 speed capabilities.

USB3Port3SpdCap.label: USB3 Port 3 Speed Capability
USB3Port3SpdCap.help_text: This setting determines the USB3 Port 3 speed capabilities.

USB3Port4SpdCap.label: USB3 Port 4 Speed Capability
USB3Port4SpdCap.help_text: This setting determines the USB3 Port 4 speed capabilities.

USB2Prt1ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt1ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 1 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt1ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the High Speed port is routed.

USB2Prt2ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt2ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt2ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 2 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt2ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the High Speed port is routed.

USB2Prt3ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt3ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt3ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 3 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt3ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the High Speed port is routed.

USB2Prt4ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt4ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt4ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 4 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt4ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the High Speed port is routed.

USB2Prt5ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt5ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt5ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 5 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt5ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the High Speed port is routed.

USB2Prt6ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt6ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt6ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 6 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt6ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the High Speed port is routed.

USB2Prt7ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt7ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt7ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 7 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt7ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the High Speed port is routed.

USB2Prt8ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt8ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt8ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 8 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt8ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the High Speed port is routed.

USB2Prt9ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt9ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt9ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 9 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt9ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the High Speed port is routed.

USB2Prt10ConTypeSel.value: Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt10ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type AB,,Type A or Type C (Host Mode Only)
USB2Prt10ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 10 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt10ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type where the High Speed port is routed.

UfsController0.label: UFS Controller 0
UfsController0.help_text: This setting enables UFS Controller 0 in x1 or x2 mode.

UfsController1.label: UFS Controller 1
UfsController1.help_text: This setting enables UFS Controller 1 in x1 or x2 mode.

Ufsx2En.label: UFSX2 Enabled
Ufsx2En.help_text: This determines if UFSX2 is Enabled.

MmpUfsx2En.label: MMP UFSX2 Enabled
MmpUfsx2En.help_text: This determines if MMP UFSX2 is Enabled.

M2Config0PullupEn.label: M2 Config 0 Pullup Enabled
M2Config0PullupEn.help_text: This setting enables the 20k pull-up for M.2 Socket Configuration 0.

M2Config1PullupEn.label: M2 Config 1 Pullup Enabled
M2Config1PullupEn.help_text: This setting enables the 20k pull-up for M.2 Socket Configuration 1.

M2Config2PullupEn.label: M2 Config 2 Pullup Enabled
M2Config2PullupEn.help_text: This setting enables the 20k pull-up for M.2 Socket Configuration 2.

M2Config3PullupEn.label: M2 Config 3 Pullup Enabled
M2Config3PullupEn.help_text: This setting enables the 20k pull-up for M.2 Socket Configuration 3.

PdMode.label: PMC-PD Controller USB Type-C Mode
PdMode.help_text: This bit should be enabled if the processor is connected to a PD controller through the SM Link interface and disabled, if not.

GppA0voltSelect.label: GPP_A0 Individual Voltage Select
GppA0voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A0 GPIO pin.

GppA1voltSelect.label: GPP_A1 Individual Voltage Select
GppA1voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A1 GPIO pin.

GppA2voltSelect.label: GPP_A2 Individual Voltage Select
GppA2voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A2 GPIO pin.

GppA3voltSelect.label: GPP_A3 Individual Voltage Select
GppA3voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A3 GPIO pin.

GppA4voltSelect.label: GPP_A4 Individual Voltage Select
GppA4voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A4 GPIO pin.

GppA5voltSelect.label: GPP_A5 Individual Voltage Select
GppA5voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A5 GPIO pin.

GppA6voltSelect.label: GPP_A6 Individual Voltage Select
GppA6voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A6 GPIO pin.

GppA7voltSelect.label: GPP_A7 Individual Voltage Select
GppA7voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A7 GPIO pin.

GppA8voltSelect.label: GPP_A8 Individual Voltage Select
GppA8voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A8 GPIO pin.

GppA9voltSelect.label: GPP_A9 Individual Voltage Select
GppA9voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A9 GPIO pin.

GppA10voltSelect.label: GPP_A10 Individual Voltage Select
GppA10voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A10 GPIO pin.

GppA11voltSelect.label: GPP_A11 Individual Voltage Select
GppA11voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A11 GPIO pin.

GppA12voltSelect.label: GPP_A12 Individual Voltage Select
GppA12voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A12 GPIO pin.

GppA13voltSelect.label: GPP_A13 Individual Voltage Select
GppA13voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A13 GPIO pin.

GppA14voltSelect.label: GPP_A14 Individual Voltage Select
GppA14voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A14 GPIO pin.

GppA15voltSelect.label: GPP_A15 Individual Voltage Select
GppA15voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A15 GPIO pin.

GppA16voltSelect.label: GPP_A16 Individual Voltage Select
GppA16voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A16 GPIO pin.

GppA17voltSelect.label: GPP_A17 Individual Voltage Select
GppA17voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A17 GPIO pin.

GppA18voltSelect.label: GPP_A18 Individual Voltage Select
GppA18voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A18 GPIO pin.

GppA19voltSelect.label: GPP_A19 Individual Voltage Select
GppA19voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A19 GPIO pin.

GppA20voltSelect.label: GPP_A20 Individual Voltage Select
GppA20voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A20 GPIO pin.

GppA21voltSelect.label: GPP_A21 Individual Voltage Select
GppA21voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A21 GPIO pin.

GppA22voltSelect.label: GPP_A22 Individual Voltage Select
GppA22voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A22 GPIO pin.

GppA23voltSelect.label: GPP_A23 Individual Voltage Select
GppA23voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_A23 GPIO pin.

GppB0voltSelect.label: GPP_B0 Individual Voltage Select
GppB0voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_B0 GPIO pin.

GppB1voltSelect.label: GPP_B1 Individual Voltage Select
GppB1voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_B1 GPIO pin.

GppB2voltSelect.label: GPP_B2 Individual Voltage Select
GppB2voltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage for the GPP_B2 GPIO pin.

GpRvoltSelect.label: GP_R[7:0] Voltage Tolerance
GpRvoltSelect.help_text: This setting controls the VCCIO voltage tolerance for the GP_R[7:0] pins and must match the voltage supplied to the VCC_PGPPR rail.

DnxPlatformId.label: Platform ID
DnxPlatformId.help_text: DnX Image attribute. Ignored before FPFs lock. After FPFs lock, DnX will compare this value to the "OEM Platform ID" FPF burned on the platform. If the values will not match, DnX Image will not be accepted by DnX.

BuildEnabled.help_text: Should Intel FIT build a DnX image

SigningKey.label: DnX image private sign key path.
SigningKey.help_text: The path to the private key to use to sign the DnX image. This setting is only configurable when OEM signing is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

OemPlatformId.label: OEM Platform ID
OemPlatformId.help_text: This setting allows OEMs to configure a Unique Platform ID into the base FPFs. Note: The OEM Platform ID FPF and Platform ID for the DnX Image should match.

InputFile.label: ME Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Embedded Controller binary that will be merged into the FWUpdate image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: PMC Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the PMC binary that will be merged into the FWUpdate image.

Enabled.label: OEM KM
Enabled.help_text: This setting Enables / Disables OEM KM in the FWUpdate image.

InputFile.label: OEM Key Manifest Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the OEM Key manifest binary merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: PCH Configuration File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the PCH Configuration binary merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

Enabled.label: ISIF
Enabled.help_text: This setting Enables / Disables Intel(R) SI FW in the FWUpdate image.

InputFile.label: ISI FW File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Intel(R) SI FW binary merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

Enabled.label: GBST
Enabled.help_text: This setting Enables / Disables GBST Config in the FWUpdate image.

InputFile.label: GBST File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the GBST Condifuration binary merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.
